Class DatabaseManager

All Implemented Interfaces:
IDBRepository
public class DatabaseManager extends Object implements IDBRepository

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    DatabaseManager(String dbType)
    The database manager handles all the required handling and forwarding of all the functions to manipulate data in the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseManager

      public DatabaseManager(String dbType) throws Exception
      The database manager handles all the required handling and forwarding of all the functions to manipulate data in the database. When initializing a new manager (which only one should exist of at any given time), it is possible to pass a 'database type' to initialize.

      Currently, these types are available:
      - sqlite
      Parameters:
      dbType - the database kind to initialize (see list above)
      Throws:
      Exception

      public ArrayList<Event> GetEvents()

      Returns:
      all events

    • GetEvents

      public ArrayList<Event> GetEvents(int range)
      Description copied from interface: IDBRepository
      This is similar to the GetEvents function (without any parameters). The only exception is the ability to supply a so-called 'range'. This will then fetch all events from newest to n (range).
      Specified by:
      GetEvents in interface IDBRepository
      Parameters:
      range - amount of events to fetch
      Returns:
      all events in range
